alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 4:22PM EST until January 08 at 2:06AM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Columbia SC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in South Carolina... Congaree River At Carolina Eastman affecting Richland, Calhoun and Lexington Counties. Congaree River At Congaree National Park-Gadsden affecting Calhoun and Richland Counties. .Heavy rainfall across the Upstate, Midlands and portions of North Carolina will produce a steady rise along the Congaree River over the next few days. Minor flooding is forecast along the river downstream from Columbia. Rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches were common over the region. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TUESDAY NIGHT TO EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Congaree River At Carolina Eastman. * WHEN...From late Tuesday night to early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 115.0 feet, Flooding occurs in low lying areas of the Carolina Eastman Facility and at the Congaree National Park. At 119.0 feet, Extensive flooding occurs in the Congaree National Park. Some area farmland is flooded. Minor flooding occurs at the Carolina Eastman Facility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:52 PM EST Monday the stage was 108.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Wednesday morning to a crest of 118.0 feet early Thursday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 115.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and take action if necessary. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 430 AM EST.
